title: France and US take head of coalition to strengthen Ukraine's artillery
summary: France will deliver another six Caesar howitzers to Ukraine, and said that 72 more would be produced this year.

title: 'Whether they convict Donald Trump or not, judges will play a role in the US presidential election'
summary: The candidate for the US presidential election and winner of the Republican primary in Iowa is weighed down by at least three criminal charges, which will bring the judiciary to bear on politics, as Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon explains.

title: 'The Global South is challenging a collective memory dominated by the Holocaust and confronting it with colonization'
summary: The hearings of South Africa's case accusing Israel of genocide before the International Court of Justice illustrate the emergence of the Global South and its challenge to the order installed by the West, writes columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Chinese tourists slow to return to France following the Covid-19 pandemic
summary: The drop in visitor numbers comes as a result of delays in obtaining visas, rarefication of flights towards France, increase in accommodations prices, and heavy competition from other destinations.

title: AFCON 2024: Egypt loses Salah to injury in 2-2 Africa Cup draw with Ghana
summary: Nigeria and Equatorial Guinea are now locked on four points at the top of the section, with Ivory Coast behind them on three points and Guinea-Bissau eliminated after losing both games so far. Nigeria beat Ivory Coast 1-0 at the Cup of Nations and Equatorial Guinea took a giant step toward the knockout stage with a 4-2 win over Guinea-Bissau.

title: Maison&Objet 2024, a rendezvous with the future of interiors
summary: Bioplastic lamps, 3D-printed furniture, autonomous housing...: The design show's theme for its 30th edition is 'Tech Eden,' outlining a future of habitable spaces thanks to innovative and ethical creations.

title: Treasure trove of Churchill artifacts on sale in New York
summary: The pieces, on sale at the Winter Show at the Park Avenue Armory in New York City, were acquired from the heir to the Forbes media fortune, Steve Forbes.

title: US lawmakers avert shutdown, keep the government funded into early March
summary: The US Congress green-lit temporary funding Thursday, January 18, to thwart a partial government shutdown that threatened the functions of multiple key federal agencies and could have seen thousands of employees sent home without pay.

title: Astronauts from Turkey, Sweden, and Italy launch to space station on chartered SpaceX flight
Report claims French far-right leader Bardella had racist Twitter account
summary: A television report on the young chairman of the far-right Rassemblement National will be broadcast fully, even though the party said that it had appointed bailiffs to block a segment relating to the anonymous Twitter account allegedly used by Jordan Bardella.

title: For lawyer Rima Hassan, Palestine is the beat of her heart
summary: Threatened with death after speaking out following the Hamas attacks of October 7, the 31-year-old French-Palestinian lawyer left France for Syria, where she was born, and Jordan, where she is preparing a book on her commitment to Palestine.

title: Netanyahu says he opposes Palestinian state in any postwar scenario
summary: The Israeli prime minister also vowed to press ahead with the military offensive in Gaza until Israel achieves 'a decisive victory over Hamas.'

title: AFCON 2024: Pitch dominated by players with two or even three nationalities
summary: African teams are increasingly relying on players born in Europe, where training and leagues are of a higher standard than on the continent.

title: At the Louvre, foreign visitors don't seem deterred by price hike
summary: Since January 15, art lovers have had to pay €22 to push the Pyramid's doors, a 30% increase in ticket prices.

title: Macron looks to boost growth and liberalize France's labor market, again
summary: The president wants to make it a priority to simplify administrative processes for businesses. He's also looking to tighten unemployment compensation rules.

title: Russians are fed up with heating blackouts and local authorities' inaction
summary: In the suburbs of Moscow and across Russia, multiple accidents on the heating networks are plunging households into the winter cold. Residents blame local authorities for long-standing infrastructure problems and under-investment.

title: French education minister recuses herself from affairs concerning kids' private school
summary: In a report, inspectors flagged unlawful practices at the elitist Catholic school Stanislas, which was put in the spotlight following Amélie Oudéa-Castéra's appointment at the Education Ministry.

title: French police protest for extra pay during Paris Olympics
summary: Several police unions urged officers to protest for a €2,000 bonus linked to the security needs of the Paris Olympic Games in July and August. French authorities have made deals with other unions, who are using the games as leverage in their negotiations.

title: Greeks outraged over price of baby formula, the most expensive in Europe
summary: According to the Hellenic Competition Commission, Greek parents are paying very high prices for powder baby formula – an average of €27 for 800 grams, compared with €14 in France.

title: Macron's reshuffle stunt: How rabble-rousing right-winger Dati became culture minister
summary: Rachida Dati, a former justice minister under Nicolas Sarkozy, was appointed culture minister last week. She struck a deal with Emmanuel Macron: The president will endorse her candidacy in her quest to dethrone her nemesis, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo.

title: Netflix's 'Emily in Paris' and 'Lupin' drive tourism, says French film center
summary: Four out of five foreign tourists to the French capital got an urge to visit after seeing a movie or TV series filmed in the city, according to a new study by France's national cinema body.

title: As Marie Curie's Paris lab faces demolition, stakeholders look for alternatives
summary: The planned demolition of the site associated with the work of the Nobel Prize double laureate, to make way for cancer research laboratories, has been suspended following intervention by national heritage defenders.

title: Video investigation: Israel's mistreatment of Palestinians detained in Gaza
summary: Multiple videos showing Palestinians stripped in the street were shared on social media. Le Monde analyzed these videos, revealing the Israeli army's degrading practices against Palestinian prisoners.

title: Paris 2024: 'Why isn't Pierre de Coubertin's Pantheonization more topical in 2024?'
summary: In his column, sports historian Patrick Clastres details the reasons opposing the induction to Panthéon of the Olympic Games 'renovator,' promoted by former Olympic champion Guy Drut and academician Erik Orsenna.

title: Canada signs over control of Arctic lands to Inuit territory
summary: The historic agreement over control of resource-rich Arctic lands to the government of the predominantly Inuit territory of Nunavut, was billed as the largest land transfer in Canada's history.

title: UK PM Sunak keeps pushing for transfer of asylum seekers to Rwanda
summary: The British leader would like to carry out the first deportations before the end of the year. Voted by MPs, the bill to deter migrants from crossing the Channel must now be examined by the House of Lords.

title: American business leaders are resigning themselves to Trump's return
summary: Reporting by CNBC found that the heads of large companies seem less worried than their European counterparts.

title: Infertility: Chemical substances omnipresent in everyday life are among the causes
summary: The number and range of suspicious molecules, the various exposure routes (food, inhalation, skin contact) and the sometimes lengthy time lag between exposure and infertility onset, make it extremely complicated to gauge the extent of these effects.

title: Layoffs at music outlet Pitchfork as Conde Nast merges it with GQ
summary: The decision has triggered anger among laid-off staff and raised concern about the future of the standard-bearer of both music reviews and news coverage of the industry.

title: Hezbollah leader Nasrallah's balancing act: Striking back at Israel while avoiding war
summary: The leader's objective is to maintain a credible deterrence posture in the confrontation that it has initiated with Israel in support of its ally, Hamas.

title: France and Germany launch joint fund to find provenance of African artifacts
summary: The €2.1 million research fund will boost bilateral cooperation at a time when France's bill on the restitution of looted African goods is on hold.

title: Samir Hamamah, gynecologist: 'Our reproductive health is at risk'
summary: Gynecologist Samir Hamamah co-authored the report that inspired the plan to combat infertility, announced on Tuesday, January 16, by French President Macron. He tells Le Monde he is delighted that the subject is 'no longer taboo.'

title: China's restrained reaction to Lai Ching-te's election in Taiwan
summary: Five days after victory for the anti-Beijing camp, China has not engaged in any major show of force.

title: Journalism's fight against injustice, a British passion in jeopardy
summary: Audiences and newsrooms alike have rediscovered the importance of investigative journalism and expertise thanks to 'Mr Bates vs The Post Office,' a miniseries that has resonated with viewers.

title: Macron appoints group of experts in effort to regulate child screentime
summary: The French president announced his intention to regulate minors's access to electronic devices like phones, tablets and game consoles. Specialists will assess screens's impact on physical and mental health and evaluate the effect of existing monitoring measures.

title: France and Qatar deliver medicine to Hamas for Israeli hostages
summary: The result of a complex deal, the agreement marks a rare breakthrough in indirect talks between Israel and the Islamist group since the truce at the end of November 2023.

title: Gaza internet blackout lasts more than a week
summary: The UN warns that the ongoing communication blackout is worsening the already extreme humanitarian situation in the Palestinian territory.

title: Russia summons French ambassador over 'growing involvement' in Ukraine
summary: Pierre Levy was summoned to the Russian Foreign Ministry on Friday and confronted with alleged 'evidence' of France's supportive role for Ukraine.

title: Finnish flights set to be grounded for two days as airport workers join February strike
summary: The commercial air traffic strike is set for the first two days of February and is expected to affect thousands of travelers.

title: Japanese moon probe 'appears to have landed'
summary: The Smart Lander for Investigating Moon (SLIM), a high-tech craft equipped with shape-shifting rovers, was designed to land in a target area 100 meters across, tighter than the usual several-kilometer landing zone.

title: Israel and Hezbollah's strange war on the border with Lebanon
summary: Fighting around Israel's northern border remains under control for the time being, but both sides are actively preparing for the prospect of open conflict.
